did.unittitle: North Carolina Mutual Life Insurance Company Archives

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: North Carolina Mutual Life Insurance Company

did.abstract: The North Carolina Mutual Life Insurance Company Archives document the founding and development of N.C. Mutual in Durham, N.C., and contribute to the historic record on African American businesses and entrepreneurship in the South and in the United States. Dating from 1850 to 2008, with the majority of the items created from 1920 to 2008, the material covers nearly every aspect of N.C. Mutual's operations, management, and milestones. There are corporate office files, including the offices of five company presidents; annual statements; reports; surveys; memos; legal and financial papers; original life insurance policies; training material; programming and outreach files; many ephemera and artifacts; and thousands of historical photographs of staff and their families, offices, buildings, and Durham scenes. Significant businessmen represented in the papers include founders John Merrick and Aaron Moore; and presidents Bert Collins, Joseph Goodloe, William Kennedy Jr., William Kennedy, III, Charles C. Spaulding, Asa T. Spaulding, and current president James H. Speed. The collection is especially rich in print material, including many issues of three company publications: The Mutual (1903-1929), The Whetstone (1924-1998), and The Weekly Review (1925-1998). It is also notable for its assemblage of material on United States African American history, including much information on other companies, and public relations material dating from the earliest years to present times, including advertising ephemera, advertising campaigns, and other related items. Other materials document NCM's outreach to the African American community throughout its history to counter racism, unemployment, and diseases by means of public health programs, church affiliations, mentoring, and scholarship programs. Over one hundred selected digitized photographs and a few documents are also available online. Acquired and curated jointly by the North Carolina Central University's University Archives, Records and History Center and the John Hope Franklin Research Center for African and African American History and Culture at Duke University.
did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the North Carolina Central University or Duke University online library catalogs.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Collection is partially restricted.

Files in the Office of the President Subseries are restricted for 25 years from the last year of each presidency. Permission to access these records must be granted by NC Mutual in writing prior to use.

Personnel files have been separated from the Office of the President Subseries, and are closed for 75 years from the date of creation of the latest material, currently 2074. There may be personnel records scattered in other series; these fall under privacy and confidentiality laws and patrons are responsible for abiding by these laws.
Also, a small portion of the collection is temporarily closed pending conservation treatment.
Original recordings are closed to use. Some use copies exist; otherwise, listening or viewing copies may need to be created for access.
Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.

Please contact staff in the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University, or in the University Archives, Records and History Center, North Carolina Central University, before coming to use this collection.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The North Carolina Mutual Life Insurance Company Archives were received by the Duke University David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library and by the North Carolina Central University University Archives, Records and History Center as a gift in 2009, and 2016.

arrangement.head: Collection Arrangement
arrangement.p: The North Carolina Mutual Life Insurance Company archives are arranged in the following series, described more fully in this collection guide: Company Offices (86 boxes), Corporate History Files (2 boxes), Digital Media (3 boxes), Exhibit Materials (25 boxes), Memorabilia and Artifacts (16 boxes), Other Organizations (9 boxes), Photographic Materials (24 boxes), Printed Materials (51 boxes), Recordings (5 boxes and 19 film cans), Social Groups and Events (1 box), and Scrapbooks (6 boxes). There are Oversize Materials sections consisting of 54 flat boxes and 10 oversize folders) listed most often after each relevant series in this collection guide.

The Company Offices Series comprises records from selected offices: Actuary, Agency, Auditing, Controller, Corporate Planning, Executive Committee, Facilities, Medical Department, Office of the President (the largest subseries; some restrictions), Public Relations, and Personnel Files (restricted). These subseries are described further in this collection guide.

bioghist.head: Historical Note

chronlist.head: Timeline for North Carolina Mutual Life Insurance Company

eventgrp.event: The Royal Knights of King David, a fraternal organization, formed by John Merrick, John Wright, W. A. Day, J. D. Morgan, and T. J. Jones to provide insurance for African Americans, chiefly for burials

Inspired by the Royal Knights of King David, North Carolina Mutual and Provident Association founded by John Merrick, Dr. Aaron Moore, P. W. Dawkins, D. T. Watson, W. G. Pearson, E. A. Johnson and J. E. Shepard
John Merrick, born during slavery, named first president; Dr. Aaron Moore, first medical director
North Carolina Mutual incorporated by the North Carolina General Assembly, began doing business selling burial insurance
Charles Clinton (C.C.) Spaulding named general manager
Dr. Aaron Moore and John Merrick founded the Lincoln Hospital in Durham to serve African Americans, with Moore as its first superintendent
First full-time insurance agents hired
NCM began to buy lots in Durham and build houses for influx of black workers
Launch of first internal publication: The North Carolina Mutual
NCM founded and provided capital for Mechanics and Farmers Bank in Durham, to better serve African Americans
NCM began issuing ordinary whole life policies in $100, $200, and $500 face amounts
Merrick-Moore-Spaulding Land Company formed; as NCM real estate subsidiary, constructed hundreds of low-cost rental houses in African American neighborhoods in Durham
Death of President John Merrick; Dr. A. M. Moore appointed as successor
NCM charter amended, changing the name to North Carolina Mutual Life Insurance Company
Dr. Donnell, new director of Medical Department, organized modern medical facilities in new Home Office
C.C. Spaulding became president after the death of Dr. Moore

The Liberty Ship S.S. John Merrick built, named in honor of the company's first president, was launched from Wilmington, N.C.; participated in the invasion of France in June 1944, making many voyages ferrying troops, tanks and supplies between English ports and Utah Beach; returned to Brooklyn, New York, April 1945
North Carolina Mutual marked its golden anniversary, producing short film, Success Story
The company reached its goal of having $200 million of life insurance in force
William J. Kennedy, Jr. appointed president after the death of C. C. Spaulding
Asa T. Spaulding appointed president after William J. Kennedy, Jr.'s retirement from the office
Director of Medical Department, Dr. Donnell, retired, succeeded by Dr. Charles Watts
The company dedicated its headquarters on Chapel Hill Street with Vice President Hubert H. Humphrey as the keynote speaker
The Board of Directors established the Merrick-Moore-Spaulding National Achievement Award
Joseph W. Goodloe became president after Asa T. Spaulding's retirement from the office
NCM broke into "Billion Dollar League" by having more than one billion dollars of insurance in force
William J. Kennedy, III became president after Joseph Goodloe's retirement from the office
Opening of the Heritage Room, a pictorial exhibit of the company's history
The company forms NCM Capital Management Group, Inc. to expand its presence in the financial arena and to diversify its business and investment mix
Director of Medical Department, Dr. Charles Watts, retired, succeeded by Dr. John Daniel, Jr.; several years later, Medical Department is discontinued
Bert Collins appointed president and CEO after William Kennedy III's retirement from the office
Board member Thelma J. Smith was named chair of the audit committee; first woman to head a major NCM committee
NCM licensed to operate in 22 states and the District of Columbia with offices in 11 states and Washington, D.C., and more than $9 billion of insurance in force
NCM celebrated its centennial anniversary
James H. Speed, Jr. appointed president and CEO after Bert Collins' retirement from the office

bioghist.p: Founded in 1898 and headquartered in Durham, North Carolina, the North Carolina Mutual Life Insurance Company is the oldest currently active African American-owned insurance company in the world. Its name changed in 2016 to NC Mutual to reflect its diversity of services beyond life insurance.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: The records in the North Carolina Mutual Life Insurance Company Archives document the history of the oldest currently active African American insurance company in the United States. The materials date from 1850 to 2008, with the majority of the items dating from 1898 to 2008, and cover nearly all aspects concerning the operation, management, and milestones of NC Mutual (NCM). The archive comprises corporate office files, including the offices of five company presidents; annual statements, reports, surveys, and memos; legal and financial files; original life insurance policies and other documents; advertising, internal and external publications, pamphlets, posters, and other print material; training material; many historic photographs; public relations and outreach material; memorabilia; and audiovisual recordings. The bulk of the collection concerns the company's home office in Durham, N.C. but there is a significant amount of material that relates to NCM district offices located throughout the United States, particularly in the South, as well as records that refer to other related organizations such as insurance companies and financial institutions.

The collection contributes significantly to documentation on the history of African American businesses in the United States, particularly in the South, and on the socioeconomic status of African Americans in the South in the 20th century. There is also valuable information on public health issues affecting 20th-century African Americans and public health programming created by NC Mutual as well as other agencies. In addition, through company records and many ephemeral publications such as obituaries, the collection offers detailed documentation of the work status and personal lives of the company's many employees and their life insurance customers, predominantly African American women and men.

The collection is rich in print materials, and includes nearly complete runs of three company publications: The Mutual (1903-1929), The Whetstone (1924-1998), and The Weekly Review (1925-1998). It is also notable for public relations materials dating from the earliest years to the mid-2000s, including advertising ephemera, materials related to advertising campaigns, and other items. Additionally, there are records of NCM's extensive community outreach such as public health, mentoring, and scholarship programs, and documents relating to the company's ties with Durham's churches such as White Rock Baptist, and with other organizations such as Mechanics and Farmers Bank.

Corporate office files form the bulk of the collection, covering nearly every aspect of the company's operations and activities from its founding in 1898. There are extensive correspondence files as well as meeting notes and minutes, many legal and financial reports, and surveys of the insurance industry. Materials relating to a published history of NCM written by one of its presidents, William Kennedy Jr., are located in the Office of the Presidents Series. Company presidents represented most substantially in the files include: William Kennedy Jr. (1952-1958), Asa T. Spaulding (1959-1967), Joseph Goodloe (1968-1972), William Kennedy III (1972-1990), and Bert Collins (1990-2003). Earlier and later presidents and leaders, including founders Merrick and Moore, and presidents C.C. Spaulding and James Speed are also represented in smaller amounts of material. Personnel records are also present and are closed to use until 2074, 75 years after the date of most recent record.

Among the several thousand photographs in the collection, hundreds date from the first decades following the company's founding, and offer important and vivid historical evidence concerning NCM's history, its employees and their families, and the history of Durham, N.C. Many are oversize, and feature twenty panoramic photographs of conventions and other events from the early to mid-20th century. The collection also contains photographs of founders Merrick and Moore and their families, NC Mutual office buildings throughout its history, and many large photographic portraits of senior administration from the earliest years to the mid-2000s. Other photos capture employees at banquets and conventions throughout the company's history; some large sets of images from the early to mid-20th century document employee's homes as well. From the historic photographs and other images not represented in the collection, NCM created a permanent exhibit in its home office's "Heritage Hall" commemorating the company's history; these exhibit images, panels, and labels are also preserved in this collection.

Acquired and jointly curated by the North Carolina Central University's University Archives, Records, and History Center, and the John Hope Franklin Research Center for African and African American History and Culture at Duke University.

userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University or North Carolina Central University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Arranged in the following subseries named after North Carolina Mutual departments and offices: Actuary, Agency in Force, Auditing, Controller, Corporate Planning, Executive Committee, Facilities, Medical Department, Office of the President, Public Relations, and Personnel Files (closed). There is also an oversize section at the end of each subseries or smaller subgrouping. The Office of the President Series holds the records from the following presidents: William J. Kennedy, Jr., Asa T. Spaulding, Sr., Joseph W. Goodloe, William J. Kennedy, III, and Bert Collins. Company office functions and spaces are also represented in other formats in the Exhibits, Photographic Material, Memorabilia and Artifacts, and Recordings Series.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: The material in the Office of the President is restricted for 25 years from the date of the end of the presidency in question, unless written permission is granted by North Carolina Mutual. The Personnel Files subgrouping is closed to public access for 75 years from date of creation of the most recent record, or 2074.]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The records relate to the Actuary Office's responsibilities of risk assessment in life insurance, investments, pensions, and other company activities and policies. Organized into two categories: Reports for the Board of Directors and Executive Committee, and Actuary Files. Actuary files include memos and consultants' studies and plans. The bulk of the material was created in the 1980s.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The center of company operations, the Agency in Force Office handles all company sales of policies, and is staffed by agents in the field, their supervisors, district managers, and home office representatives. By 1948, the company already had over 1,000 agents in force throughout the South. The material of this subseries includes Executive Committee directives and decisions, agency-related files and ledger books, and the G.W. Cox papers. The Agency files contain salary information, several issues of The Weekly Review, memos, and manuals. The subseries also contains policy loan certificates and claims dismissal correspondence with the Receiver from Woodmen Union Life Insurance Company.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Mailed to NC Mutual's offices in 1969 by an executive in Baltimore, this life insurance policy was sold by an insurance organization in Raleigh by the same name of NC Mutual, which was organized in the 1840s and disbanded in the 1860s. A blank life insurance policy specifically for slaves printed by this same company can be found in the Charles Hunter Papers in the Rubenstein Library at Duke. It is not known what connection, if any, this company had with the subsequent NC Mutual founded in Durham in 1898.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The Office of the Controller is in charge of coordinating, planning, and reporting on financial activities, including bookkeeping, accounting, and financial reporting. The material in this subseries consists of the Report of the Controller to the Board of Directors for NCM, ranging from 1986-2001. Also contains annual reports, annual statements, and Bonds and Stocks Owned statements.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains detailed materials on the research, planning, execution, and move to the new Mutual Plaza home office, 1964-1967, including blueprints for the home office and the Chatham annex. Also includes plans for long-range planning such as organizational and management restructuring; business plans by company department; reports, manuals for the functions and duties of home office organization; reviews of data processing, and correspondence with management consulting firms and other companies. Additionally, contains alphabetized files of general correspondence, as well as solicitations to NCM for donations from organizations such as National Urban League, Nursing Association, 4-H, and the Hampton Institute and other higher education entities.

Also present are materials and operations manuals for several other African American-run life insurance companies such as Jackson Mutual Life (1947), General American Life Insurance, and Equitable of Iowa.

There is one file in box 20 housing a small group of interesting speeches given by Goodloe, Spaulding, and others for a variety of occasions including racial conflicts during the 1960s, and a copy of Kennedy's Historical Sketch of NCM history.
Includes information regarding Murray Marvin (one of the directors of Corporate Planning) during his time at both Jackson Mutual and NC Mutual.

Note: The structure of the Corporate Planning department changed several times over the course of NC Mutual's history. Corporate Planning and Public Relations merged under Murray Marvin in 1967 and was reorganized into Planning and Communications around 1976.

scopecontent.p: Mainly pertains to business conducted by the Executive Committee, a standing committee of the Board of Directors, which is made up of a minimum of five Directors, at least one of which is required to be an outside Director. Material from the Salary Committee, another standing committee of the Board, is also included in this subseries. The Salary Committee consists of five of the Directors, one of whom must be the President of the company.

Arranged in alphabetical order by folder title. Other archival records and memorabilia on medical topics and health campaigns can be found in the Printed Material, Publicity, and Memorabilia Series.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This subseries consists of material from the offices and files of five of NCM's nine presidents: William J. Kennedy, Jr., Asa T. Spaulding, Sr., Joseph W. Goodloe, William J. Kennedy, III, and Bert Collins. The contents relate mainly to the periods during which these presidents held the office, though in some cases there is material from previous positions they held within NCM and apart from the company. Much of the material includes files relating to the execution of company business, correspondence, and personnel matters. The majority of the material in the subseries originates from the offices of William Kennedy III and Bert Collins.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Files in the Office of the President Subseries are restricted for 25 years from the last year of each presidency. Permission to access these records must be granted by NC Mutual in writing prior to use.
Personnel files found in this series have been separated and are closed for 75 years from the date of creation of material, or 2074.
Please contact the Rubenstein staff for more information.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Served as President of NC Mutual from 1952-1958. Much of the contents of this subseries comprises the materials that Kennedy, Jr. used to document the history of North Carolina Mutual, as well as the wide variety of historical sketches he produced. Other material in this subseries relates to general company business from his tenure at NCM both as the Corporate Secretary and as President, including a letter of support for Pauli Murray's admission to the New York State Bar Association in 1948. Additionally, there is material relating to his tenure as the President of the Bankers Fire and Casualty Insurance Company.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: [Some of the material found in box 33 is fragile and should be handled with care. Contact reference archivist before using, as material may need photocopying before use.]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Collins served as the President of NC Mutual from 1990-2003. Prior to his role as president, Collins served as an Executive Vice President for the company. Includes documents dating from when he first joined the company in the 1970s through until near the end of his tenure as president, with the majority of the material dating from 1985-1994. The contents are organized into four categories: budget/finance, company business/personnel, correspondence, and other organizations. Some personnel records were removed to Personnel Subseries. Arranged in rough alphabetical order or in original order as received. There are many records pertaining to Collins's affiliation with North Carolina Central University.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Material in files chiefly documents activities such as advertising, publications and printing, and community relations projects undertaken by North Carolina Mutual. The Photographic Material Series also houses an extensive collections of images used by the Public Relations Department in publications such as The Whetstone.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The bulk of the material dates from the 1980s and consists of bids, invoices, contracts, shipping lists, and correspondence regarding advertising in specific periodicals, radio stations, and television stations. Also included are memos, drafts, sketches, and research regarding advertising strategy, specific advertisements, and promotional events. This subseries also contains clippings, sample ads, and promotional materials, such as calendars and pamphlets, and photographic plates of group shots and advertisements. Other promotional items are housed and described in the Memorabilia and Artifacts Series.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Documents NCM's various programs and activities related to community outreach through scholarship support, mentoring programs for youth, and community health programs such as anti-smoking campaigns. Materials consist of event programs, pamphlets, clippings, speeches, photographs, certificates, and leaflets. A substantial portion of the materials are related to the Merrick-Moore Scholarship in the 1930s, including lists of colleges and students, bills, receipts, and correspondence from awardees. Also of note are materials related to the Avery Boys' Club, including a binder belonging to W.J. Kennedy, Jr. Other programs and events are related to the United Negro College Fund, NCCU, the Boy Scouts, Greater Durham Arts Fund, a letter from President Reagan, the 1943 launch of the S.S. Merrick, and Founders' Day celebrations.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: [Box 70 contains some fragile material that is in need of preservation. Please contact Research Services to use this material, as contents may need to be photocopied before being handled.]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note

Mutual and John Merrick, and various Founders' Days. Materials consist of slides, photographs, clippings, correspondence, programs, print materials, memos, and other planning documents. Also included are historic NCM policies and certificates.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Files of mixed correspondence concerning the Public Relations Department. The bulk of the files date from 1984-1986. Materials also include solicitations, brochures, and subscription forms. Topics include radio and television stations, interview requests, A.T. Spaulding, Ben Ruffin, and W.J. Kennedy, Jr.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Additional materials created by the Public Relations Department that do not fit in above categories. Topics include office contests, employee benefits, taxation, the donations committee, smoking cessation program files, the new products committee, the lyrics to the company song, and the history of African Methodism. Materials include phone messages, personnel forms, notes, agenda, minutes, memoranda, brochures, correspondence, an architecture showcase book, a drawing of a house, information collected regarding Hispanics, and a memoir about life insurance.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Files open to research access contain company publicity regarding personnel, including, but not limited to, obituaries, biographies, a list of employee birthdays, and other announcements. Among those profiled are Asa T. Spaulding, C.C. Spaulding, Jr., William Henry Harvey, W.E. Williams, W.E. Coleman, W.D. Hill, J.L. Wheeler, W. Lionel Cook, and Fred R. Moore. Several folders related to the retirement and death of William Kennedy, Jr. contain extensive photographs alongside paper materials. Folders profiling women associated with NCM contain copies of The Whetstone and photographs from the 2000s.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Assembled by staff of NC Mutual and a former company archivist, these files contain a sampling of the most significant historical documents illustrating the formation of the company, its founders, and its first decade of existence. Materials are varied and include charters and by-laws; early policies, publications and advertisements; significant correspondence; programs, annual statements, and Christmas greetings; items marking milestones in company history; and other unique items. There is also a folder with two charts for 1933 and 1941 ranking the current African American owned life insurance companies, including NCM. Other historical and early items can also be found throughout the collection, especially in the Agency, Memorabilia, Photographic Material, and Print Material Series, and the Office of the President Subseries; early examples of policies from 1902 into the 1930s are found in the Agency Series. Arranged in rough chronological order.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Houses the components of the many exhibits assembled and curated by North Carolina Mutual staff, most of which were part of a large exhibit on NCM history in the company's Heritage Gallery in the Mutual Building on Chapel Hill Street in Durham. Other exhibits were created for specific events such as conventions.

Mostly consists of black and white or sepia images and captions reproduced from original photographs and mounted on thin board, often with velcro backing. A good selection are from vintage photographs from the early years of the company. Later images, some in color, show officers and employees in meetings, conferring, or posing for portraits. Finally, some exhibit panels are reproductions of advertisements and other broadsides. The exhibit boxes also house large groups of caption cards, labels, and informational panels.

This group also includes two framed letters of interest: one from Eleanor Roosevelt's secretary, writing in July 1934 subsequent to a visit to NCM by Roosevelt in June of that year, and the other a strongly worded letter written by President Spaulding on improving the company's performance, entitled "Open Letter to Managers," from Berlin, Germany, 1931.

Thousands of additional images illustrating the company's history are housed in the Photographic Materials Series, including original photographs from which the exhibit images were reproduced. Some additional exhibit materials may be found in this series.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains a wide variety of items that document recognition of achievements, advertising campaigns, and company and employee milestones throughout the history of NCM. Organized into four subseries: Artifacts, Awards and Memorabilia, Plaques, and Promotional Items.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Material includes a very early papers portfolio probably belonging to E.R. Merrick; a glass ornament; medical supplies; sales logs; an early 20th century leather satchel with the company name (oversize box); and a large 1950s or 1960s-era travel case housing an insurance sales training kit.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Promotional folded portfolio measuring 5.0 x 10.75 inches, stamped on cover with "Valuable Papers, Compliments of North Carolina Mutual and Provident Association," plus a group of documents originally filed within. Probably belonged to E.R. Merrick. Original contents bearing his name include receipts for personal house furnishings, a piano, and baby furniture, among others. For preservation purposes, papers are now housed in separate folders.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The Awards and Memorabilia Subseries houses publicity for insurance coverage and charitable giving, and awards and certificates for NCM employees, as well as awards received by NCM from external organizations. Includes a company award featuring a bronzed shoe belonging to C.C. Spaulding, and two copies of the Merrick-Moore Award. Also includes a 1943 Western Union telegram from then-governor of N.C. Broughton to C.C. Spaulding concerning the launching ceremony of the U.S.S. Merrick (box 90). The first box is arranged in two groups of folders, beginning with memorabilia (chiefly publicity and programs), and then awards.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Two groups of awards: plaques marking achievements within the company of its employees and officials, and plaques received by NCM honoring the company for its contributions to the community, commemorating its lifetime membership in the NAACP, and other milestones.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Created to administer the Lincoln National Life Museum, the Foundation provided an avenue for charitable, tax-exempt contributions of Lincoln memorabilia to the museum. It appears that the NCM Corporate Planning department requested information from the Lincoln National Life Foundation regarding its annual report and bylaws in 1975.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Founded in 1929 by C.C. Spaulding, E.R. Merrick, and R.L. McDougald to provide greater financial independence for black businesses in Durham, N.C. Although this company stood as a separate corporate entity from NCM, many of the members of the Executive Committee were leaders at NCM, and the company was somewhat connected with NCM in practice. The material consists of the early minutes of the Executive Committee of the Mortgage Company of Durham.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Established in 1921 as the National Negro Insurance Association (later renamed National Insurance Association or NIA), and was created in order to promote and represent the mutual interests of insurance companies that were owned and operated by African Americans. C.C. Spaulding was elected as the first president of the association and NCM has remained one of the largest member companies of the organization to the present. NCM employees have regularly served on the Board of Directors and as officers for the NIA.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The thousands of photographs in this series document the history of North Carolina Mutual Insurance through images of its employees and their families, buildings and other places, and company events. The images range from formal portraits and group shots to snapshots taken at banquets, conventions, meetings, on trips, and around the office.
There are many 19th century photographs of NCM leaders and their families, staff, including women workers, the earliest home office buildings, office interiors, and community events.

Individuals depicted in later images include NCM officers, employees, their families, and prominent figures such as Robert F. Kennedy, Martin Luther King, Jr., Spiro Agnew, Jesse Jackson, ambassadors, and other politicians. Many significant original images were reproduced by NCM in various sizes and for various purposes; some of these reappear in the Exhibits Series material.

The bulk of the 20th century images were produced by the Public Relations Department for The Whetstone and The Pilot and are therefore often marked for cropping and resizing. Although some images are captioned with names, years, and locations, many are unmarked and many dates have been estimated. Some related paper material, such as clippings, biographical sketches, speeches, copies of publications, and memos transmitting the images, can also be found with the prints.
Materials are arranged into subseries by format. There are also slides, negatives, and negative reproductions found with corresponding photographs in the Prints Subseries.

Comprising the bulk of the series, the Prints Subseries is arranged into Events, Historic Images, Other Public Relations, People, and Places Subseries. There is considerable overlap, however, for example between Events and People. Many related items are also found in the Exhibit Material Series.

Large-format photographs and albums are located in the Oversize Prints section listed at the end of this series. These items include historic images of the company's early offices, portraits of senior administrators, group shots at banquets and other events, and images of the NCM home office buildings. Sizes range from 11x14 inches to roughly 32x40 inches, as well as a very large panoramic print of the early home office on Parrish Street, 27x75" (closed to use; digital viewing copy is available).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains negatives and negative reproductions stored separately from prints. Items are arranged in loose chronological order and then into broad categories by content. Negatives directly associated with prints may also be located in the Photographic Prints subseries.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Original negatives are closed to use; viewing copies may be requested. Please contact the Rubenstein Library before coming to use these materials.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Mostly produced by the Public Relations department for publications such as The Whetstone and The Pilot, the prints are arranged into Events, Historic Images, Other Public Relations, People, and Places subseries, and within, chronologically.

Of note in this series are historic photographs of North Carolina Mutual offices, leaders, and staff; as well as early images of the families of its founders. These early images were arranged in various groupings by staff, and are found in other series in the collection, especially as reproductions in the Printed Materials Series.

Formats include 19th century and early 20th century prints such as cartes-de-visite, platinum, and gelatin silver prints, as well as modern black-and-white prints. One may also find negatives, slides and some related paper records in the series. Panoramic prints, largely associated with events, and other large format images are found in the Oversize Prints section listed at the end of the series.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Photographic materials, especially early and mounted prints, can be fragile and vulnerable to damage. Please handle carefully. Negatives may only be used by permission of the Curator of the John Hope Franklin Collection of African and African American History.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Arranged chronologically, these images depict banquets, conventions, trips, and meetings hosted or attended by NCM staff. Most but not all were labeled. Significant events include annual meetings of the National Insurance Association, a 1964 speech by Robert F. Kennedy, a 1964 trip to Mexico and Central America, and the celebration of NCM's 85th anniversary in 1983. Other events include awards ceremonies, retirement celebrations, the Annual Policy Holders' Meeting, Founders' Day, enrollment drives, and charitable events, such as an AIDS Walk and blood drives. Prominent event titles are included. Individuals depicted include NCM officers, employees, their families, politicians, and figures such as Robert F. Kennedy, Spiro Agnew, Jesse Jackson, and the Nigerian ambassador to the U.S. Some negatives and related paper documents are also included.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photographs arrived in bundles and their order has been retained. Candid and posed photographs of assorted events, including employee recognition, holiday parties, meetings, annual conventions, and company trips. Also includes group and individual portraits. Some photographs contain captions, but the majority do not.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains early black-and-white images of North Carolina Mutual officers, employees, their family members, corporate meetings, office interiors, and groups related to NCM, such as Thrift Clubs, musical groups, and sports teams. These files were assembled by staff in their own separate grouping; additional historic images can also be found in the People Subseries, as well as throughout the Printed Materials Series, where they are often found reproduced in publications of many types.

Formats are wide-ranging, and include true photographic prints, both mounted and unmounted, in albumen, platinum, and gelatin silver processes; printed images on paper; clippings; and photographic copy prints from the late 20th century. Oftentimes there are crop marks and other editorial marks made by the Publications Department staff.

Large-format historical images of the NCM offices and its officers and employees are also found in the Oversize Prints section at the end of this series; sizes range from 11x14" to approx. 32x40"; there is also an extremely large panoramic print 27x75" of the Parrish Street home office, closed to use until conservation treatment is completed.
Arranged alphabetically by folder title and within in loose chronological order.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Collection of 132 black-and-white photographs ranging in size from approx. 3x4" to 8x10", with three predominant types of images appearing in this order: the exterior of the home office on Parrish Street in Durham; interiors from the 1920s-1940s, including many early departments and their staff and equipment; and portraits of officers and other staff. Many of the subjects are identified on the back of the print. A series of commercially-made images of the medical and other departments in the 1940s are particularly of note. A few image slots are empty (#16, 134-137).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Arranged in loose chronological order, this subseries contains mixed images, almost all black-and-white, of events, people, and places produced by the Public Relations Department for exhibits and publications such as The Whetstone and The Pilot.

Some folders are related to specific issues of publications or composite pages while others are more intermixed. Many of the images in this subseries overlap with other subseries. Those depicted include NCM officers, employees, their families, policy holders, politicians, and prominent figures such as Robert F. Kennedy, Martin Luther King, Jr., and Jesse Jackson. Some negatives, reprints of older images, clippings, and related paper materials are also included. The bulk of the material dates from the 1960s.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Primarily contains images of the North Carolina Mutual physical plant, including different office buildings, men and women staff members on the job, workspaces, equipment, mainframes, decorations for specific events, and the construction of the 1965 home office. Includes photographic images of the original office buildings from circa 1900 to an architect's rendering of the new home office, circa 1963. Other images of the home offices can be found in oversize photo boxes and in the exhibits series. Of particular interest are a series of images of NCM employees' homes, which are labelled with the employee's name, rank, and city. Also included are scenes in Durham, N.C. and snapshots from business trips to Puerto Rico and Miami.

The majority of the 20 panoramic photographs feature large group portraits taken at national and regional insurance association conventions and meetings, some as early as 1916 and 1917, and range in size from 18.75x8 inches to 44.5x8 inches. scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Arranged into the following subseries: NCM Publications, Non-NCM Publications, and Periodical Clippings. The first two subseries are further subdivided into two large format groupings: Pamphlets and Other Publications, and Serials. These files were assembled by NCM staff and offer a rich array of printed resources on African American history, culture, and businesses. Formats include essays; reports; pamphlets; brochures and fliers for products, initiatives, and events; newsletters; newspapers and clippings; journals; popular serials; internal publications, including a full set of NC Mutual's serial, The Whetstone, promotional literature for North Carolina Mutual as well as other organizations, and a set of obituaries (1944-2005) memorializing company staff, most of which contain full biographies.

The substantial clippings file was assembled by the Public Relations Department, and is arranged topically in its original sequence; there are significant amounts of materials on the civil rights movement and on Durham history.

There are also oversize sections at the end of each subseries chiefly housing newspapers and other serials; early whole issues as well as single pages of Durham newspapers can be found here, as well as newspapers from elsewhere, and issues of mainstream magazines such as Ebony. The Non-NCM subseries in addition contains a large sub-grouping of print items related to Durham's historically black North Carolina Central University (NCCU), including campus newspapers and events programs.
Series, subseries, and their files are further described in this collection guide.

did.unittitle: North Carolina Mutual Life Insurance Company Serials

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Series comprises internal North Carolina Mutual serial publications, arranged alphabetically by title, then chronologically. Consists primarily of nearly complete runs of three company publications: The Mutual (1903, 1923-1929), The Whetstone (1924-1998), and The Weekly Review (1925-1998). Some large runs of issues are housed in original binders. One binder with mixed contents contains various samples of NCM publications, including an issue of The Whetstone (second quarter 1963); two issues of The Mutual; a pamphlet about the origins and history of the company, dated November 23, 1921; and the proceedings of the Annual Agents' Conference of 1920. A fourth publication is The Hotline (1988-1997). Listings in the collection guide include oversize material, found at the end of the series.

did.unittitle: North Carolina Mutual Life Insurance Company Pamphlets and Other Publications

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Various publications issued by North Carolina Mutual. The earliest piece, circa 1917, is a pamphlet from the Life Extension Department of NC Mutual, by Medical Director Clyde Donnell, M.D., on the health risks associated with flies, especially the spread of diseases, giving advice on eliminating flies from human inhabitations. Other items include programs from memorial services; publications commemorating company anniversaries and the opening of new offices; The Mutual Album (a booklet containing photographs and biographies of NCM's founders and early employees); Education in our Democracy (a reprint of a speech that W.J. Kennedy, Jr. gave at Fort Valley State College); The Negro's Adventures in the Field of Life Insurance and Partners in Business (instructional tracts written by W.J. Kennedy, Jr. and Asa T. Spaulding, respectively); and various sales, promotional, and recruitment material, and training manuals. Arranged alphabetically by title or subject.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Various items related to organizations other than North Carolina Mutual. Includes a large collection of material related to African American history; a number of government publications (primarily concerning either the African American population or the state of the economy); files from a 1973 audit of NCM conducted by the firm Ernst and Ernst; brochures and booklets related to health education; and publications produced by the NAACP, the National Urban League, the Southern Regional Council, the National Insurance Association, the Institute of Life Insurance, Ebony, the United Negro College Fund, the National Council of Negro Women, and the Peace Corps, among many others. Arranged in alphabetical order by title or subject, with oversize material at the end.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Consists of a large black-and-white poster measuring approximately 36x48 inches, displaying the history of Africans and African Americans in the United States from the 1700s to the 20th century. Includes small portraits and biographies of notable individuals: abolitionists, politicians, authors, artists, and civil rights leaders. Background paper color is ivory; fonts and portraits are in brown.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Series houses sound and moving image recordings spanning many decades and documenting milestones in North Carolina Mutual History. Formats include audiocassettes, audio tape reels, film reels, and videocassettes.
Audiocassettes are few in number and include a set of home-study tapes on insurance practices.

Subjects of films include a history of North Carolina Mutual; the history of "Black Wall Street" in Durham; the groundbreaking and dedication ceremonies for the current headquarters building on Chapel Hill Street in Durham; and advertisements and broadcasts about NC Mutual products and services. Titles of films listed have been taken from original canister or box labels. Many of these films were copied in digital format to DVD, around 2002 (see listings of digitized moving images in Digital Material Series).

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Original audiovisual recordings are closed to use. Access to these materials may require production of listening or viewing copies. Please contact Research Services before coming to use this collection.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Varying in size and condition, these scrapbooks commemorate the history of North Carolina Mutual Life Insurance through clippings, photographs, memos, programs, and other items. Also found in the photographic material section in the Oversize Material Series are photo albums that also commemorate company personnel, conferences and other events, and milestones.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: [Scrapbooks are fragile; some are slated for further preservation treatment. Please contact Research Services before coming to use this material.]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Commemorating the dedication of new home office building, this scrapbook chiefly contains many pages of congratulatory messages in the form of letters and telegrams, many from notable officials, politicians, and businessmen.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: History of NC Mutual from its beginnings to the 1970s. Almost completely made up of cut-outs from the company publication Whetstone.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains newspaper clippings of NCM advertisements, along with a photograph, clippings of competitor's ads, and an event program. Approximately 25" x 17".

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Eighteen-page portfolio (approximately 13" x 16") belonging to calligrapher and illustrator Walter W. Micheaux. Micheaux was recognized as an expert penman and, after moving from South Carolina. in 1916, illustrated and hand-lettered the insurance policies, publicity, logos, and other material for NCM for over 20 years. Scrapbook contains many original examples of his work, as well as a 1928 clipping about him (with photo), and a small photo of him as an older man.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: [Extremely fragile. Slated for conservation treatment. Please consult with a reference archivist before using.]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The majority of the contents of this scrapbook are dedicated to the launching of the S.S. Merrick in honor of John Merrick on July 11, 1943. Also includes a specially-bound edition of the Whetstone edition honoring NCM's 50th anniversary, as well as various newspaper clippings relating to individuals and other entities connected to NCM. Other items laid in to the scrapbook are copies of a letter and photo from President John F. Kennedy, a 1946 Whetstone honoring John Merrick, and an unidentified Atlantic City vacation photograph of NC Mutual staff, circa 1940s.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Scrapbook of newspaper clippings belonging to J.L. Wheeler, NCM Agency Director of the Southern Region.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes photographs from the 1990 meeting in San Francisco, CA.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes photographs and invitations.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Files relate to social clubs and events for North Carolina Mutual employees. The groups that are chronicled in these files include the NCM Glee Club and the Tuesday Morning Study Group, a self-improvement group composed chiefly of the wives of NCM administrators that met to read about and discuss political, social and cultural topics of the day. Materials on the latter make up the majority of these items.

did.unittitle: Tuesday Morning Study Club: Correspondence and memorabilia, 1966-1977
Tuesday Morning Study Club: Agendas and readings, 1973-1976
Tuesday Morning Study Club: Materials on meeting topic, "The Great Transition," 1977

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: "The Great Transition" theme taken up by the NCM social group, the Tuesday Morning Study Club, may refer to the term as used by Kenneth Boulding, social reformer, economist, educator, and systems scientist, in 1965, to mean a pivotal moment in social science and human society as it transitions from the 20th to the 21st century.
